author: Hespress EN
title: Two Australian citizens killed by an IDF strike in Lebanon
text: Mark Dreyfus, Australia‚Äôs acting foreign minister, announced on Thursday that an Israeli attack in Lebanon claimed the lives of two Australian citizens, Ibrahim Bazzi and his brother Ali Bazzi. From Sydney, Ibrahim Bazzi had traveled to Lebanon to join his Lebanese bride Shorouq Hammoud on her way to Australia. According to media accounts, Hammoud‚Äîwho had just been granted an Australian visa‚Äîwas also assassinated in the attack. Funerals for the three were held overnight in Lebanon. The three died in their home following the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) attack, with no signs of fighting nearby preceding the strike. ‚ÄúWhen they found her she was alive but she died shortly after,‚Äù said the official to the National regarding Shourouq‚Äôs death. Dreyfus stated that his government had discussed the airstrike with Israel, but he would not unveil what was said, reported ABC News. ‚ÄúIn the context of the current conflict, Australia has consistently called for civilian lives to be protected and we have consistently raised our concerns about the risk of this conflict spreading,‚Äù Dreyfus said. He restated a government warning cautioning Australians against visiting Lebanon. Australians who have already arrived in the nation ought to depart as soon as commercial flights continue to operate. He also stated that if the Bazzi family needed consular support, the Australian embassy in Beirut was prepared to help.

author: Sky UK Limited
title: Where the Northern Lights could be visible tonight as aurora makes a return to the UK
text: Northern Lights put on spectacular display as people share their sightings of the aurora borealis People across the UK have been capturing the dazzling natural phenomenon. Friday 11 October 2024 02:50, UK The Northern Lights have returned to the UK in spectacular style, visible across huge parts of the country. This year, the famed aurora has made [a couple of appearances](https://news.sky.com/story/northern-lights-glow-up-skies-across-uk-and-around-the-world-see-best-pictures-here-13133267) as far south as the UK, [producing stunning pictures](https://news.sky.com/story/northern-lights-stargazers-share-stunning-images-of-aurora-borealis-13213762) as a result. The phenomena is chiefly influenced by geomagnetic storms, of which the Met Office said there was a "severe" one due to reach Earth overnight on 10 October. This brought sightings of the aurora all over the UK on Thursday night, with reports that it was visible across Britain, as far south as Sussex. The Met Office had said that viewings were likely in Scotland and Northern Ireland and possible in the north of England and the Midlands. However, thanks in part to relatively clear skies, they were visible for huge numbers of Britons well beyond this. Met Office spokesperson Stephen Dixon said that further residual viewings could be possible over the weekend - but this is likely to be confined to the likes of Scotland. Rain and cloud could also obscure further viewings over the weekend. Near peak solar cycle The auroras are most common over high polar latitudes but can sometimes spread south over parts of the UK. The geomagnetic storms that chiefly influence them often originate from the sun, which works on a cycle of around 11 years with peak sunspot activity referred to as solar maximum. Sunspots give the potential for Earth-directed releases of large bursts of energy, called coronal mass ejections (CME), which can lead to aurora visibility. Read more from Sky News:[Man charged with 'dognapping'](https://news.sky.com/story/man-charged-with-attempted-murder-also-first-to-be-charged-with-dognapping-under-new-law-13231381)[Football Manager video game suffers major delay](https://news.sky.com/story/popular-video-game-football-manager-delayed-until-next-year-13231544)[Grim choice given to death row inmate](https://news.sky.com/story/south-carolina-death-row-inmate-richard-moore-asked-how-he-wants-to-be-executed-13231261) Mr Dixon said: "We're near the peak of that solar cycle so there have been more space weather events in recent months. "International prediction centres, including the Met Office Space Weather Operations Centre, are expecting solar maximum to be later this year or early next year." It will still be possible to see the Northern Lights once we pass solar maximum but there will be a decline in such activity. [ ](/download-app) Be the first to get Breaking News Install the Sky News app for free The aurora displays occur when charged particles collide with gases in the Earth's atmosphere around the magnetic polls. As they smash into one another, they emit light at various wavelengths, creating the stunning sights.

author: Pierluigi Paganini
title: More than 2,000 Palo Alto Networks firewalls hacked exploiting recently patched zero-days
text:
Threat actors already hacked thousands of Palo Alto Networks firewalls exploiting recently patched zero-day vulnerabilities. Thousands of Palo Alto Networks firewalls have reportedly been compromised in attacks exploiting recently patched zero-day vulnerabilities ( CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474 ) in PAN-OS.
CVE-2024-0012 is a vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS that allows unauthenticated attackers with network access to the management web interface to bypass authentication and gain administrator privileges. This access enables administrative actions, configuration tampering, or exploitation of other vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-9474. The issue affects PAN-OS versions 10.2, 11.0, 11.1, and 11.2 but does not impact Cloud NGFW or Prisma Access.
CVE-2024-9474 is a privilege escalation vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows a PAN-OS administrator with access to the management web interface to perform actions on the firewall with root privileges.
This week, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added both vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog .
In mid-November, Palo Alto Networks confirmed it had observed threat activity exploiting an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability against a limited number of firewall management interfaces which are exposed to the Internet.
Palo Alto said the zero-day has been exploited to deploy web shells on compromised devices, granting persistent remote access.
‚ÄúPalo Alto Networks and Unit 42 are engaged in tracking a limited set of exploitation activity related to CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474 and are working with external researchers, partners, and customers to share information transparently and rapidly.‚Äù reads the report published by Palo Alto.
The cybersecurity firm initially observed malicious activities originating from the following IP addresses
136.144.17[.]* 173.239.218[.]251 216.73.162[.]* The advisory pointed out that these IP addresses may be associated with VPN services, for this reason, they are also associated with legitimate user activity.
‚ÄúPalo Alto Networks continues to track additional threat activity following the public release of technical insights and artifacts by third-party researchers beginning on Nov. 19, 2024. At this time, Unit 42 assesses with moderate to high confidence that a functional exploit chaining CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474 is publicly available, which will enable broader threat activity .‚Äù continues the report. ‚ÄúUnit 42 has also observed both manual and automated scanning activity aligning with the timeline of third-party artifacts becoming widely available.‚Äù
The investigation is ongoing, and the cybersecurity firm updated the list of Indicators of Compromise .
Shadowserver researchers, who are tracking the number of compromised Palo Alto Networks firewalls, reported that approximately 2,000 have been hacked due to a CVE-2024-0012/CVE-2024-9474 campaign. Most of the hacked devices are in the US (554) and India (461).
Heads-up! Thanks to collaboration with @NCA_KSA
we are now scanning & reporting Palo Alto Networks devices COMPROMISED as a result of a CVE-2024-0012/CVE-2024-9474 campaign.
Found ~2000 instances compromised on 2024-11-20: https://t.co/7t95RBKdxr
Top affected: US & India pic.twitter.com/Ors5jhMMxz
‚Äî The Shadowserver Foundation (@Shadowserver) November 21, 2024
Follow me on Twitter: @securityaffairs and Facebook and Mastodon
Pierluigi Paganini
( SecurityAffairs ‚Äì hacking, PAN-OS)

author: Jo√£o Guerreiro Rodrigues
title: Imunes e quase indetet√°veis. Estes drones est√£o a revolucionar a guerra e a mudar a paisagem na Ucr√¢nia
text:
Nos campos devastados da Ucr√¢nia, uma nova teia de fios de fibra √≥tica est√° a reescrever as regras da guerra moderna
Ao longo dos mais de mil quil√≥metros da linha da frente na Ucr√¢nia, algo est√° a mudar na paisagem do terreno que separa as for√ßas russas das ucranianas. Um emaranhado com milhares de cabos de v√°rios quil√≥metros, que se assemelham a gigantes teias de aranha, est√° a cobrir o solo dos campos. Todos os dias surgem milhares de novos fios, resultado de um dos mais mort√≠feros desenvolvimentos tecnol√≥gicos russos que surgiu na invas√£o da Ucr√¢nia. Imunes √† guerra eletr√≥nica e quase imposs√≠veis de detetar, os drones kamikaze controlados com longos cabos de fibra √≥tica est√£o a mudar a guerra, a paisagem e a Ucr√¢nia est√° a correr para tentar recuperar o preju√≠zo.
Seis meses s√£o uma eternidade para a velocidade da inova√ß√£o militar para dois pa√≠ses em guerra. O in√≠cio da invas√£o russa, que come√ßou com enormes colunas de blindados russos a avan√ßar no terreno apoiados por avi√µes e helic√≥pteros e que rapidamente deu lugar a uma intensa guerra de trincheiras, desencadeou uma corrida pela supremacia tecnol√≥gica. Em desvantagem material, a Ucr√¢nia encontrou nos primeiros meses de guerra a solu√ß√£o para muitos dos seus problemas nas aeronaves n√£o tripuladas a que chamamos drones. Em 2023, dezenas de oficinas come√ßaram a produzir milhares de drones por m√™s que chegavam em poucas horas √†s unidades na linha da frente.
O zumbido de um pequeno drone FPV (first-person-view) carregado de explosivos tornou-se o principal receio das dezenas de milhares de homens e mulheres que combatiam na linha da frente. Os drones e os seus pilotos tornaram-se excecionalmente certeiros e o n√∫mero de baixas do lado russo disparou. As for√ßas de Kiev especializaram-se na produ√ß√£o e utiliza√ß√£o deste tipo de aeronaves n√£o tripuladas, desenvolvendo v√°rios tipos com diferentes fun√ß√µes, mas tamb√©m aprendendo novas t√°ticas e formas de os utilizar. Atualmente, 80% de todas as baixas russas no campo de batalha s√£o resultado de ataques de drones.
Moscovo come√ßou a invas√£o com uma severa escassez desta tecnologia. O Kremlin tentou encurtar terreno com a ajuda de Teer√£o, obtendo uma licen√ßa para produzir drones de longo alcance Shahed. Mas o fosso continua a existir nas outras categorias que dominavam a linha da frente, como os drones FPV ou os de reconhecimento, como da portuguesa Tekever. Em resposta, Moscovo desenvolveu algumas das mais poderosas armas de guerra eletr√≥nica, capazes de perturbar os sinais das aeronaves, inutilizando-as. Kiev tentou fazer o mesmo, mas a dimens√£o da produ√ß√£o ucraniana, que fez 1,5 milh√µes de drones em 2024, era suficiente para continuar o elevado n√∫mero de baixas.
Mas em 2024, algo mudou. A R√∫ssia come√ßou a experimentar algo diferente nos seus drones. Os militares russos incorporaram um pequeno tubo com um cabo de fibra √≥tica enrolado com v√°rios quil√≥metros de comprimento, que liga a aeronave ao seu operador. √Ä medida que voam, estes drones de baixas altitudes v√£o desenrolando o cabo altamente resistente √† medida que se v√£o afastando do piloto.
A exist√™ncia de uma f√≠sica entre o drone e o operador resolve um dos principais problemas que este tipo de armas encontravam no campo de batalha, onde muitos deles perdem o contacto com o piloto, depois de serem alvo de medidas de guerra eletr√≥nica. Esta tecnologia permite tamb√©m que as aeronaves consigam aceder a √°reas que antes eram inacess√≠veis aos drones FPV, porque perdiam o sinal, como florestas ou entre edif√≠cios. Para os militares, isso significa que as √°reas da frente que antes eram seguras podem estar agora debaixo de fogo inimigo.
Mas as diferen√ßas n√£o se ficam apenas pela qualidade do sinal entre o drone e o operador. A fibra √≥tica permite que o piloto receba uma imagem de alta qualidade at√© ao momento da detona√ß√£o do explosivo, mesmo a grandes dist√¢ncias. Os cabos de fibra √≥tica s√£o bastante resistentes, baratos e leves, o que permite aos drones transportar cartuchos com dezenas de quil√≥metros de fios com apenas poucos quilos. Nas redes sociais, um utilizador mostra um dep√≥sito com 50 quil√≥metros de cabo de fibra √≥tica com apenas 3,8 quilos.
ü§¨ Chinese man demonstrates a 50 km fiber optic coil, custom-made for the Russians. The coil weighs only 3.8 kg.
‚Äî MAKS 25 üá∫üá¶üëÄ (@Maks_NAFO_FELLA)[pic.twitter.com/6221Ji4szW][June 5, 2025]
Apesar do peso reduzido que permite percorrer longas dist√¢ncias, esta carga extra tem desvantagens. Os drones FPV t√™m uma capacidade de carga limitada e o peso a mais obriga a reduzir a quantidade de explosivos a bordo. Estas caracter√≠sticas obrigam estes drones a ter estruturas maiores, com motores e baterias mais potentes, mas que resultam num dispositivo mais lento e menos manobr√°vel, o que o pode tornar mais vulner√°vel a ser abatido com armas ligeiras. Al√©m disso, as longas linhas de fibra √≥tica correm o risco de ficar presas em algum objeto ou simplesmente enrolar-se.
Quando atingem o alvo ou s√£o destru√≠dos, o cabo de fibra √≥tica que liga o drone ao operador fica ca√≠do no ch√£o. Conforme estes cabos se acumulam nos campos e nas cidades, come√ßam a tornar-se vis√≠veis e a refletir a luz do sol, o que permite aos militares identificar a posi√ß√£o original do seu operador. Isto obriga os soldados a mudar de posi√ß√µes com frequ√™ncia, num constante jogo do gato e do rato.
Tanto a Ucr√¢nia como a R√∫ssia est√£o a fazer de tudo um pouco para tentar descobrir uma forma de contrariar esta tecnologia, mas sem sucesso. Um estudo russo, por exemplo, tentou encontrar uma forma de conseguir detetar o cabo de fibra √≥tica atrav√©s do espectro infravermelho, tornando os cabos vis√≠veis a drones com vis√£o noturna ou equipamento infravermelho. S√≥ que os investigadores dizem que esta descoberta n√£o ter√° grande utilidade no campo de batalha, uma vez que s√≥ √© poss√≠vel √† noite e as c√¢maras mais comuns utilizadas na frente n√£o o conseguem fazer.
At√© l√°, este tipo de drones vai conseguindo obter grandes sucessos no campo de batalha. Em Kursk, onde a Ucr√¢nia lan√ßou uma ofensiva no ver√£o de 2024, foram fundamentais para o contra-ataque russo que acabou por expulsar as for√ßas do general Oleksandr Syrskyi, em mar√ßo de 2025. Vaga atr√°s de vaga, dezenas de drones com cabos de fibra √≥tica atacavam as for√ßas ucranianas, que pouco ou nada conseguiam fazer contra estes ataques. Nos √∫ltimos meses da ofensiva, o abastecimento da linha da frente era praticamente imposs√≠vel e os militares russos atingiram tudo o que mexia na retaguarda ucraniana.
‚ÄúA nossa log√≠stica entrou em colapso. Os drones de fibra √≥tica monitorizam todas as rotas, n√£o havendo forma de entregar muni√ß√µes ou provis√µes‚Äù, disse Dmytro, um m√©dico ucraniano que lutava a partir da cidade russa de Sudzha, ao Kyiv Independent.
O mesmo est√° a acontecer em v√°rios pontos da frente, onde os militares ucranianos est√£o a relatar um aumento significativo dos ataques contra ve√≠culos na retaguarda, ligados a um aumento da atividade deste tipo de drones na frente de combate. Na regi√£o de Toretsk, um soldado relatou que a sua brigada ficou sem qualquer ve√≠culo de evacua√ß√£o m√©dica em apenas um m√™s.
A Ucr√¢nia, que tem uma ind√∫stria de drones robusta, est√° a tentar adaptar-se e correr atr√°s do preju√≠zo para apanhar as capacidades russas. Para isso, os fabricantes ucranianos precisam apenas de adquirir grandes quantidades de fios de fibra √≥tica de qualidade, s√£o produzidos pela China e vendidos no AliExpress. S√≥ que a proximidade de Pequim ao Kremlin faz com que muitos dos produtores queiram distanciar-se e diversificar os seus fornecedores.
Mas, apesar de os drones serem considerados baratos, esta tecnologia faz disparar o pre√ßo de um drone para quase o dobro. Segundo uma an√°lise do Ukrinform, em mar√ßo, o pre√ßo do cabo de fibra √≥tica por drone aproxima-se dos mil euros por unidade. O drone custa entre 300 e 600 euros, sem explosivos. Feitas as contas, o pre√ßo destes drones com um fio de 25 quil√≥metros pode atingir os dois mil euros. O valor √© bastante superior ao dos atuais drones FPV, mas a efic√°cia destas armas parece justificar a transi√ß√£o.
S√≥ que, para j√°, a utiliza√ß√£o destes drones est√° restrita √†s unidades de elite ucranianas, como o regimento Achilles ou a unidade de drones do batalh√£o Azov. Mas todos sabem que este ano todos os olhos estar√£o postos nesta tecnologia, que deve chegar a um n√∫mero cada vez maior de unidades ucranianas. At√© l√°, a vantagem permanece nas m√£os das for√ßas russas, que est√£o a aumentar a intensidade dos ataques um pouco por toda a frente. Seja como for, o emaranhado de fios vai continuar a cobrir os campos ucranianos, testemunhas silenciosas de uma guerra que a tecnologia n√£o para de mudar.

author: VINCE ANGELO FERRERAS and MARIEL CELINE SERQUI√ëA ,GMA Integrated News
title: 'A saint of our time': Blessed Carlo Acutis offers relatable holiness in modern times | GMA News Online
text:
millennial might be the next saint of the Catholic Church.
Meet Carlo Acutis, an Italian whose brief life was devoted to promoting the Catholic faith online and providing for the poor.
Acutis, who passed away due to leukemia in 2006 at the age of 15, is set to become a saint after the Vatican declared that he had interceded from heaven to save two lives.
In this series, GMA News Online explores the life of Acutis, the miracles credited to his intercession, and the significance of having a millennial saint as a role model for young Catholics worldwide.
LAST OF THREE PARTS
While most of the saints that we know were born centuries ago or died in old age, the young Blessed Carlo Acutis could offer a new model of holiness that is within reach.
Acutis, who was tech-savvy, could be the first millennial saint for spreading God's word through the internet.
"And being a millennial saint, Carlo Acutis offers a model of holiness that is more or less very close to our own time, very close to our own situation, and very close to our own context," said assistant professor Leo-Martin Ocampo, a faculty member of the University of Santo Tomas (UST) Institute of Religion.
‚ÄúYou can be a saint without looking like a person from the past. That‚Äôs the model of Carlo Acutis as a millennial saint, a saint of our time,‚Äù he added.
FIRST PART : Carlo Acutis: Brazilian boy's healing attributed to 'God's influencer'
SECOND PART : Carlo Acutis: A mother's faith clears millennial's path to sainthood
Acutis was born to Italian parents in London on May 3, 1991. But he succumbed to leukemia on October 12, 2006, at the age of 15.
When he was still alive, the upcoming saint shared the same interests as any teenager of this day. From gaming, pets, travel goals, and taking photos, Acutis lived like a normal teenager.
He documented verified Eucharistic miracles across the globe and put up a website called ‚ÄúEucharistic Miracles of the World.‚Äù
According to his mother, Antonia Salzano, Acutis read university text books on logarithm and programming. But what impressed her was that ‚Äúhis zeal for the Lord and his love for the knowledge of Jesus prompted him to make use of his talents to create a website,'' the Vatican News said.
Being ahead of his time, Acutis poses a challenge to the youth to use the internet for evangelism.
‚ÄúI think that would be the challenge to all of us right now in our generation, especially the millennials, that at a young age and in this age we use technology, how can we contribute to the spread of faith and live the virtues that the faith teaches us?‚Äù said Ivan Gozum, also a faculty member of the UST Institute of Religion.
Holy life
For 24-year-old law student Unique Roque, having a millennial saint like Acutis could inspire young people to live a holy life.
‚ÄúBlessed Carlo Acutis knew the same world we do now because he lived not so long ago. If he was able to live a life of holiness, we also can,‚Äù she said.
Roque shared that she keeps a healthy spiritual life as she regularly prays, follows the sacraments, and occasionally participates in some parish activities.
If there is one thing she learned from the life of Acutis, Roque said that one does not have to be a martyr to live a holy life.
‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt have to face persecution and be martyred to live a holy life. All he did was offer everything he did to God. When he opened his computer and browsed the internet, he did it for God,‚Äù she added.
Meanwhile, for two young Dominican friars, sharing one‚Äôs faith is something you should not be ashamed of.
‚ÄúRight now, there is a temptation to be shy and even embarrassed about our faith on social media. And society is telling us to be silent and private about our religious convictions,‚Äù said Bro. Dominic Eugene Aboy O.P.
‚ÄúBut as Christians, we must preach the truth, whether in season or out of season. When we are embarrassed about our faith, it‚Äôs like we are embarrassed about our relationship with Jesus,‚Äù he added.
Just like Acutis, Bro. Joenner Enriquez O.P. also used the power of the internet to provide online catechisms.
‚ÄúSa panahon kung saan talamak ang fake news at kabi-kabilang pagyurak sa pananampalatayang Katoliko na ipino-post sa social media, napapanahon na na tayo naman ang kumilos upang ipagtanggol ang ating pananampalataya,‚Äù Enriquez said.
(In a time where fake news is rampant and the Catholic faith is being challenged on social media, it is time that we act and defend our faith.)
He added that there is nothing to be afraid of when sharing the gospel.
‚ÄúWe are God‚Äôs mouthpiece here on earth. And let us not be afraid, for whoever preaches the Word of God, God is with them. This is not our battle; it is the Lord‚Äôs,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd we are merely his weapons here on earth to show the modern people that He is around, always with us, in our daily lives, and even on social media.‚Äù
'Deeper meaning of faith'
But sharing faith in the age of social media shouldn‚Äôt be complicated or explicit; it can sometimes be seen in our attitude.
‚ÄúThe deeper meaning of faith is our relationship with God. And if you have a good relationship with God, it will show in the way you carry yourselves. You will be a positive presence on the internet and in your interactions with others,‚Äù said Ocampo.
Even simple acts can make us saints for others.
‚ÄúIn the life of Carlo Acutis, there is holiness in being ordinary, because his life really showed us that one does not need to perform extraordinary deeds to achieve holiness,‚Äù said Gozum.
‚ÄúOur daily acts of kindness, our joy, and our ability to live our faith authentically in our situations are a reminder for us, just like what Pope Francis said, that we are next-door saints; there‚Äôs sainthood in all of us regardless of status and age.‚Äù
Acutis is now inches away from sainthood after Pope Francis recently recognized the second miracle attributed to him: a university student was healed from a severe head trauma in 2022.
Acutis was beatified in 2020 following the healing of a Brazilian boy from a rare congenital disease in the pancreas in 2013.
Pope Francis said that he would soon convene a Consistory of Cardinals to deliberate the canonization of Acutis. ‚Äî VBL, GMA Integrated News

author: Jon Heath
title: NFL news: Sean Payton explains decision to bench Russell Wilson
text:
The Denver Broncos benched quarterback Russell Wilson on Wednesday, a move that was likely influenced at least in part by the QB‚Äôs contract.
If Wilson suffers a serious injury and can‚Äôt pass a physical in March, his $37 million salary in 2025 would become guaranteed. Benching the QB rules out the risk of Wilson getting injured in one of the final two games of the season.
Broncos coach Sean Payton acknowledged an ‚Äúeconomic‚Äù aspect of the decision on Wednesday, but he also insisted that he‚Äôs trying to get a spark and win games. Payton apparently believes quarterback Jarrett Stidham gives the team a good chance to win over the next two weeks.
‚ÄúMost of you know we made a change at quarterback,‚Äù Payton said after Wednesday‚Äôs practice. ‚ÄúI understand all the speculation and everything that surrounds a move like that. I can tell you [that] we‚Äôre desperately trying to win.
‚ÄúSure, in our game today there are economics and all those other things, but the No. 1 push behind this ‚Äî and it‚Äôs a decision I‚Äôm making ‚Äî is to get a spark offensively. Obviously, it‚Äôs difficult.‚Äù
When asked for specifics, Payton initially danced around the question before mentioning turnovers and scoring.
‚ÄúRather than get into the specifics ‚Äî because I think that would be unfair today ‚Äî it‚Äôs more about what we weren‚Äôt doing effectively enough offensively,‚Äù Payton said. ‚ÄúWhen we were getting two or three turnovers, that‚Äôs one thing. Ultimately, our job is to get the ball in the end zone, and we have to be more efficient doing that ‚Äî all of us.‚Äù
Wilson isn‚Äôt the only one who has struggled on offense, though, so why is he the one taking the fall?
‚ÄúI get that, and yet, I can‚Äôt replace the entire offensive line,‚Äù Payton said. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt bring in five new receivers. If [the offense struggling] continues over a period of time, there will be another guy here talking to you, as well. These are difficult decisions. Obviously, there‚Äôs more attention when it‚Äôs the quarterback who‚Äôs under contract, but different than maybe earlier decisions we‚Äôve made with last year‚Äôs prior starters.
‚ÄúI can just assure you one thing ‚Äì I‚Äôve said this to Greg [Penner] and George [Paton] a number of times ‚Äì I‚Äôm just interested in winning. It doesn‚Äôt matter how. When you do this for this long a period, that‚Äôs all you‚Äôre interested in because there‚Äôs nothing like it. The other side of it ‚Äî there‚Äôs nothing like that, either. That‚Äôs kind of what it is.‚Äù
Stidham, who will replace Wilson, has started two games in his career, both of them losses with the Las Vegas Raiders last season.
